caption: www.fanedit.org
description: The Internet Fanedit Database (IFDB) is a database of fanedits vetted by the Fanedit.org Academy*. IFDB is intended to provide information about what edits have been made, and allow fans of fanediting a means to review edits that they have seen. Neither IFDB nor its parent site, Fanedit.org, host li…
message:
I fell into the rabbit/hobbit-hole after watching the fan-edit of the Hobbit trilogy last night (which was good). Watched "Star Wars - The Last Turn to the Dark Side" (an edit of of eps I, II, and II into one movie) today.

What I learned from this edit is that nothing can really salvage those movies. The raw footage is inadequate to yield a tight narrative. It tries, and does an admirable job, but there's only so much you can do. (e.g. Characters are sent to locations across the galaxy for trumped up reasons because they look cool. Or maybe they just need to move their mission hubs somewhere less frustrating. :-) )
name: Internet Fanedit Database - Home
